info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 4:52PM EDT until June 17 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ORANGE AND SOUTHERN SPOTSYLVANIA COUNTIES... At 452 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles northeast of Louisa, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Spotsylvania, Gatewood, Thornhill, Logan, Partlow, Brokenburg, Lahore, Glenora, Post Oak, Thornburg, Snell and Alsop. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
